thread.title: Niagara opens hockey season
thread.title_full: Niagara opens hockey season - Sports - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: Niagara opens hockey season
text:
Last year, Niagara opened its hockey season with road losses at Clarkson and St. Lawrence. The Purple Eagles finished the campaign at 7-28-4.
Niagara will reverse the order of its opening games this year. Maybe that will lead to a reversal of their record.
The Eagles come into Friday’s game at St. Lawrence (7 p.m., Radio 1340) with hopes for better times. Niagara does have some firepower returning this season. Players who produced 71 percent of the team’s points are back.
The Purple Eagles warmed up for the game last weekend with an 5-3 exhibition win over Wilfrid Laurier University of Ontario. Defenseman Vinny Muto had a goal and two assists, while Nick Farmer added two goals.
Freshman goalie Guillaume Therien is expected to be the starter for the Eagles tonight.
